column4: Hey ! I need some help in turning of HDMI-soundcard in Ubutu or any other way to get my Realtek HD audio to work. It seems the "normal" soundcard aint in use. using a laptop asus m51ta - Realtek HD audio alc663
do you mean you have two sound cards and you want to turn off one (like the built in one on the mobo)?
you probably need to figure out what driver is loading for the built in card, remove it and the blacklist it. that is what i did because i use an external sound card

no clicking around for this i'm afraid. Step one is to see what modules are loaded. Try "cat /proc/asound/modules" for that, and see if you can not determine which one is for the sound card you want to disable. Step two is to blacklist that driver in "/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist". Step 3 is edit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base to load the proper driver. Step 3 may not be necessary. That's the basic outline i would say
